column4: More port questions. ssh from Starbucks. Not port 22 cause it's blocked. Port 8080 let's say. The connection reaches my router. How does the ssh service that listens to port 22 know to listen to port 8080? Isn't port forwarding to have your inbound ports directed to the private ports?
you can tell ssh where to listen to (which port), set in the sshd_config /etc

do you know of a link to a tutorial? I just learned ssh 2 days ago trying to set up a web proxy being I'm leaving the states... And I'm running out of time to finish this set up and don't have a lot of time to learnsometing else
no prob, let's go :
gksudo gedit /etc/ssh/sshd_config
got it
found it already ?
was talking to cast, told me about it but on reading more by brain melted
gksudo gedit /etc/ssh/sshd_config
argh... sorry DasEi... My proxy server is a mac
but it looks like I can edit the config file easy enough.
erm, this is ubuntu, but config shall be same
and look for something similar in mac :
the netbook I'm taking is ubuntu... setting em up together brought me here
# Port 22.... that line is hashed out because it's default. But if I unhash it and put in 9050-9999, that will make ssh listen to those ports?
no sure about syntax in mac, one port or seperated ones should do
ok... I'll check on syntax. Just wanna make sure the question I'm gonna ask makes sense first. So something like 22,25-1000... would make sense on that line?
yesss
SWEET
thanks for your patience. Really needed it
there you go, but keep topic here : http://tinyurl.com/2d7xgdn
awesome! Thanks again.
